results.title: One hundred harvests
results.brief_description: Soundtrack currently not matched with picture. Quality violin music at begining, before the histroy of wheat farming in victoria is delivered through narration. It closes with a gentle orchestral piece that lasts around 60 seconds.

results.title: Fifty miles from Poona
results.creator_credit: Fali Bilimoria, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film from the heart of India is a story of a rural Hindu family. The film evokes sympathy and understanding for things people everywhere have in common: the love of a farmer for his land, the devotion of a mother to her children. This is the day-to-day life of Vishnu Shevale and his family in the village of Phursangi, fifty miles from Poona.

results.title: 23 Skidoo
results.creator_credit: Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: If you erase the people of downtown America, the effect is bizarre, not to say disturbing. That is what this film does. It shows the familiar urban scene without a soul in sight; streets empty, buildings empty, yet everywhere there is evidence of recent life and activity. At the end of the film we learn what has happened. Awards: London; Cracow; Salerno.

results.title: 21-87 (D)
results.creator_credit: Arthur Lipsett, Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A wry comment on the machine-dominated man, the man to whom nothing matters, who waits on chance for his number to come up. An experimental film presenting a succession of many unrelated views of passing crowds - church, in the street, in the circus. The effect is chaotic, but true to life. (Awards: Chicago, Ann Arbor, Palo Alta.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Lipsett, Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Twentieth century focus: health hazards. Part 3. Drugs
results.creator_credit: Gordon Croton and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Attempts to present a factual picture of drug-taking in Britain today. It deals with the extent of addiction, the social and medical effects, the legal situation, examines attempts being made to confront the problem.

results.title: 12th Tokyo Motor Show: 1965
results.brief_description: The annual Tokyo Motor Show displays the progress of the Japanese motor industry to the nation and visitors from overseas. A wide variety of vehicles are manufactured in Japan and this annual event creates great interest from business people and car enthusiasts. Planned by the Japan Motor Industrial Federation.

results.title: Mice Milking
results.brief_description:
Please be advised: this film contains scenes of animal restraint that some viewers may find disturbing.

This film, made by the Victorian Department of Agriculture, documents the process by which mice are milked in a laboratory at the Safe Research Farm in Werribee, for use in cancer research. The narrator explains that in mice, leukemia and mammary cancer are similar to cancer in humans and the virus is present in their milk. The mice milking machine in use in the film was developed by research officer Graeme Mein for demonstration in an open day at Werribee, based on those used by the National Cancer Institute, USA. The film shows laboratory technicians attaching a mouse to the machine and milking them.

results.title: 11.59: last minute to choose
results.brief_description: A study of the social and psychological factors involved in drug abuse. Various sections of the drug culture are contrasted using split screen techniques. “11:59” brings you into the hospital emergency room, the teenagers are shown in frank discussion groups, exploring attitudes and seeking solutions. WARNING: Contains footage of drug use, overdose and emergency treatment in hospitals.

results.title: May 1955 pig carcase competition
results.brief_description:
Propaganda piece highlighting Victoria’s development as the foremost producer of pork in Australia. Competition received a record number of entries and the winning score of 93/100 for a carcase was the highest total ever in Australia. Winner was a ‘new Australian’ from Italy.

The cracases are beautifully displayed and almost fetishised as if in an art gallery. Everyone involved takes great joy, interest and pride in the meat displayed to an amusingly earnest extent. The images are high-contrast with vibrant reds and greens. A combination of the above provides a beautifully surreal quality to the piece.

Amusing sound grabs from narration such as “Here we have a veritable paradise of pork”.

Interesting ‘The End’ illustration, good for Postcards, etc.

results.title: The Mallee Research Station
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture, Ann Millard and Colin Webb
results.brief_description:
This film, made by the Victorian Department of Agriculture, was created to promote the ingenuity of agricultural scientists working at the Mallee Research Station in Walpeup, Victoria.

The film highlights the research station’s development of wheat production, sheep breeding and pasture improvements. It contains some wonderful examples of farm machinery and farming techniques of the era.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture, Ann Millard and Colin Webb
